venue.address_2: cross street Center between Chapel and Crown
venue.name: Bentara

item.description:
Hello everyone! Life has a way of moving mountains when you least expect it, and that's the reason I've been only a memory to the old-timers!

Perhaps I'm coming out of retirement to organize this event! Picture it! The greatest minds of New Haven: artists, entrepreneurs, the guy who bought a wind turbine for his New Haven family business-

all meeting in New Haven to share their ideas, invite feedback, and network with other creative thinkers!

From their website:

PechaKucha is celebrating a year in New Haven with our cool cool Summer edition
tomorrow, Wednesday, 25 August, at Bentara. 7:30pm.

[And by "celebrating" we mean "borrowing a fancy projector" to project bigger than ever. (That's what? Dorky?)]

We have
therapy outsourced to a phone app,
guerrilla gardening, Unmade Beds, polar bears,
and foam rubber headgear,
just for starters.
Check out the full lineup here

Mosquito-free and guaranteed not to be rained out. Hope to see you there.

Greta Hotopp and Shunji Ohta
for
PechaKucha Night - New Haven
http://www.pecha-kuch...

I'm Eric, tall, glasses, probably wearing a wind turbine-inspired shirt, and if you were in the NHC 2006-2009, you'll recognize me!
My phone number is in my RSVP. Please, no calls after 7:25p- but you may text!

**Bring a friend! Business cards optional. Open mind- not!
item.how_to_find_us: I'm tall, glasses, wearing a wind turbine-inspired shirt
item.name: Pecha Kucha - New Haven
